Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back
Jewelry: Beads necklace and earing in right ear
Sweater: Blue, Sweatshirt with text or logo "St. Theresa Point"

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2014005212.CaseDesc: Terry Rowe was involved in a boating accident on Lake Simcoe in Ontario on May 14, 1977. He is believed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven Woytowich is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2014004566.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1981, at approximately 5:00pm, Dennis Krioul was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Dennis’ wife states that he was in some business trouble and he had a warrant out for his arrest for fraud.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: Mary Nancy Goodfellow and her grandson Kevin James Charles left their home in Chitek Lake, Saskatchewan on April 3 1993. There has been no news of them since.

Scar: Forehead, Scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2018059815.CaseDesc: Leroy Custer was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, on August 30, 2018.

Case reference: 2014003808.CaseDesc: On June 10, 1979, Edward McMichael was seen for the last time when he was staying at the YMCA in downtown Vancouver, British-Columbia. He previously travelled to the Yukon and Alberta and worked in the mining industry.

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville, Quebec. He was living in Longueuil, Quebec. Gilles left in his vehicle and his vehicle was later found on September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2023012025.CaseDesc: On March 6th, 2023 shortly after 12:00 pm, Kimberly Jackson was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Kimberly was despondent.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Samurai skull with a knife

Case reference: 2014002093.CaseDesc: Wilhemina (Winnie) Wanner went missing from her home on January 3rd, 1989 in Red Deer, Alberta.

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2012020110.CaseDesc: On September 23 2000, Nathalie Godbout was seen for the last time in the Saint-Romuald district in Lévis, Quebec. Nathalie was the mother of two children.

Case reference: 2014005629.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2011, Yoo Heo was seen for the last time at a Youth Centre in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Yoo had recently arrived to Canada from Korea.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: John Groves was reported missing on July 8, 1981 from North West River, Newfoundland & Labrador.  The Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified of an aluminum boat with an outboard motor going in circles  in Sheshatshiu, Labrador. Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been occupied by John Groves and it appears that he had fallen overboard and drowning was suspected. John's body of has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar

Case reference: 2014002959.CaseDesc: On December 1, 1998, Frederick Pilkington was seen for the last time near the Table Rock area in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Frederick was despondent.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003107.CaseDesc: Jean Fournier was last seen in Montreal on August 30, 1993. He was very stressed and depressed. He left a letter for his wife stating that he was leaving all of his belongings to her. He left his house with little money in his pocket.

Sweater: Cotton, Cream, Ivory, Black, black stripes

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2006020699.CaseDesc: Frank Turtle was last seen on May 12, 1994 at South Camp on Peishk Lake, near Red Lake, Ontario. His boat was found but Mr. Turtle was never found.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005958.CaseDesc: Dallas Broich was last seen at his residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on October 8, 2012. He was supposed to report for work in Fort McMurray, Alberta, the following day but never arrived. Dallas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent
Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2014001469.CaseDesc: On November 28,1988, Douglas Babineau was seen for the last time at a party located on First Avenue in Moncton, New Brunswick. Douglas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014000002.CaseDesc: Dennis Bastillo was living with his family at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen near the Lions Gate Bridge between Vancouver and West Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014003927.CaseDesc: On April 8, 1983, Blake Moorehouse was last seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm in Richmond, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Mr. Moorehouse and his companion Harold Brentzen left for the day to go freshwater fishing. The boat that Mr. Moorehouse and Mr.Brentzen were on board was recovered approximately 1.2 km north of the Roberts Creek Terminal. Mr. Brentzen's body was recovered near the boat, but Mr. Moorehouse was not located.

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area

Case reference: 2014003230.CaseDesc: Mr. James McGrath was reported missing on May 31, 2001, by family members.  At the time of his disappearance he was residing near Patrick's Cove, NL.  Mr. McGrath lived alone, and was last seen walking on the roadway approximately seven days before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: On May 27, 2008, Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001592.CaseDesc: Robert Mc Sween was reported missing by a family member on October 14, 1994. He was last seen September 18, 1994. The last contact he had with his family was by phone at the beginning of October 1994. Details of the coming and goings of Mr. Mc Sween are unknown by family members. His vehicle was found abandoned in the yard of a restaurant in Montreal.

Case reference: 2014001237.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of a well nourished man were found floating in Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had his natural teeth and had taken his own life.

Case reference: 2014002462.CaseDesc: Michel Blanchette resided in north-Montreal and was seen for the last time on October 6, 1972. Late that evening, he went to "Taverne Duvernay" located on "Boulevard de la Concorde" in Laval where he went missing and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2012020120.CaseDesc: On October 19th 2003, Jeanne-D'Arc Asselin, 66, was to go to her boyfriend's but called to cancel at the last minute. Ms Asselin went to buy beer at the convenience store and was never seen again. She disappeared from Valleyfield. During the months prior to her disappearance, she seemed confused and had memory loss. Ms Asselin had suffered a stroke in the past.

Case reference: 2019043440.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2019, Victor Cuthand was reported missing from the City of Brockville, Ontario. Victor’s last known whereabouts were at a shelter located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, as of March, 2020. This was also the last time that Victor had communicated with his family.

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2021047301.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2001, Margarito Perez-Hernandez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along the bank of the Ottawa river in Gatineau, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004157.CaseDesc: Mark Krostewitz was seen for the last time on June 7, 1989 in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Percy was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2006027099.CaseDesc: Mr. Deorksen and two acquaintances were travelling on Kioshkokwi lake, Pentland Township, Kiosk, Ontario, in a canoe when it capsized. The two acquaintances were located deceased, but Mr. Deorksen has never been found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001408.CaseDesc: On September 13th, 1997, two fishermen failed to show up at their final destination and as a result they were reported missing to police. An immediate search of the lake was conducted and one of the men was found alive on a island. HUNTER was never found.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2016067449.CaseDesc: Jennifer Hillier-Penney was last seen in St. Anthony, NL on November 30, 2016.  It is believed that she went missing around 8:00 pm that evening from a residence in that community. Her personal belongings, including her cell phone, purse, shoes and jacket were left behind.

Scar: on knee from surgery, unsure which knee
Tattoo: Capricorn sign on wrist, unsure of which wrist
Right Chest, eye of horus on the right rib

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2014001666.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1995, Shawn McEleney was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. Shawn was known to attend the racing tracks in Edmonton and Calgary.

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000083.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1999, Jean-René Duguay was seen for the last time when he was seen jumping off the Lachapelle Bridge in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-René’s body was never found.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2008003199.CaseDesc: Police received information that Toivo Reinikainen had not returned to work at the Great West Timber Camp on the Deadhorse Road in Walsh Twp (northern Ontario).  He had been observed on site on September 26, 1984 at 4:00 a.m. by his co-workers.  The camp location is a relatively remote area, access is by Deadhorse Road which is open to the public.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003100.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1995, Jacob Sallenback was seen for the last time at his residence in Calgary, AB.

Shirt: Other, TEE, Kings Crew logo, Aqua

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003787.CaseDesc: Jo Ann Comeau, was last seen on February 9th, 2001, in Saint John, NB. Joanne suffers from Muscular Dystrophy and walks with an unsteady gait.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.
